item.title: Are simplified language texts worth reading in language learning? - Western Philsophy in Simple Spanish by Olly Richards
item.description: In my quest to learn Spanish, and my continued attempts to maintain my French, have led me to the ‘input method’ of language learning. According to this, the primary thing which determines a language learners command of the language is the amount of comprehensible, high-quality input which they get. Naturally, it can be very difficult when first starting a language to understand anything, let alone native-level media on subjects that you’d be interested in.
